Groups

  • Group forum permissions
User security
  • Ban emails
  • Ban IPs
  • Ban users
  • Disallow usernames

Setting permissions

Permissions are based on a simple YES/NO system. Setting an option to NEVER for a user or usergroup overrides any other value assigned to it. If you do not wish to assign a value for an option for this user or group select NO. If values are assigned for this option elsewhere they will be used in preference, else NEVER is assumed. All objects marked (with the checkbox in front of them) will copy the permission set you defined.


» User permissions
Select type:


User permissions

Anonymous
All YES · All NO · All NEVER
Advanced Permissions
No role assigned…
  • Standard Features
  • Limited Features
  • All Features
  • No Private Messages
  • No Avatar
  • Newly Registered User Features
  • Profile
  • Post
  • Private messages
  • Misc
Setting Yes No Never
Can view profiles, memberlist and online list
Can change username
Can change password
Can change email address
Can change avatar
Can change default usergroup
Can change profile field information

The permissions and role defined for this item will only be applied to this item and all checked items.

Setting Yes No Never
Can attach files
Can download files
Can save drafts
Can disable word censors
Can use signature
Can use emoji and rich text characters in topic title

The permissions and role defined for this item will only be applied to this item and all checked items.

Setting Yes No Never
Can send private messages
Can send private messages to multiple users
Can send private messages to groups
Can read private messages
Can edit own private messages
Can remove private messages from own folder
Can forward private messages
Can email private messages
Can print private messages
Can attach files in private messages
Can download files in private messages
Can use BBCode in private messages
Can use smilies in private messages
Can use [img] BBCode tag in private messages
Can use [flash] BBCode tag in private messages

The permissions and role defined for this item will only be applied to this item and all checked items.

Setting Yes No Never
Can send emails
Can send instant messages
Can ignore flood limit
Can hide online status
Can view hidden online users
Can search board

The permissions and role defined for this item will only be applied to this item and all checked items.



Submit changes

body.valueA:
Administration Control Panel

Admin index • Board index

Skip to content

  • General
  • Forums
  • Posting
  • Users and Groups
  • Permissions
  • Customise
  • Maintenance
  • System

You are logged in as:
user [ Logout ][ ACP Logout ]     

Users
  • Inactive users
  • Manage users
  • User permissions
  • User forum permissions
  • Custom profile fields
  • Prune users
  • Manage ranks
Groups
  • Manage groups
  • Manage group positions
  • Group permissions
  • Group forum permissions
User security
  • Ban emails
  • Ban IPs
  • Ban users
  • Disallow usernames

User permissions

Here you can assign global permissions to users - user permissions, global moderator permissions and administrator permissions. User permissions include capabilities such as the use of avatars, sending private messages, et cetera; global moderator permissions such as approving posts, manage topics, manage bans, et cetera and lastly administrator permissions such as altering permissions, define custom BBCodes, manage forums, et cetera. To alter these settings for large numbers of users the Group permissions system is the preferred method. User permissions should only be changed in rare occasions, the preferred method is putting users in groups and assigning the group permissions.

Look up user
[ Find a member ]

Create new forum

The form below will allow you to customise this forum. Please note that moderation and post count controls are set via forum permissions for each user or usergroup.

Forum settings

Once created, the forum will have the same permissions as the one you select here. If no forum is selected the newly created forum will not be visible until permissions had been set.

Any HTML markup entered here will be displayed as is. If the selected forum type is a category the description is not used.

Location, relative to the phpBB root directory, of an additional image to associate with this forum.

Defines a password for this forum, use the permission system in preference.

Only needs to be set if a forum password is entered.
General forum settings

If set to yes active topics in selected subforums will be displayed under this category.
General forum settings

Displays this forum’s subforums on the index and elsewhere as a link within the legend if their “List subforum in parent-forum’s legend” option is enabled.

Limits the subforums to be displayed to subforums that are direct descendants (children) of the current forum. Disabling this will display all subforums with the “List subforums in legend” option enabled, regardless of depth.

Displays this forum on the index and elsewhere as a link within the legend of its parent-forum if the parent-forum’s “List subforums in legend” option is enabled.

If set to yes users are able to review their post if new posts were made to the topic while users wrote theirs. This should be disabled for chat forums.

Enables the quick reply in this forum. This setting is not considered if the quick reply is disabled board wide. The quick reply will only be displayed for users who have permission to post in this forum.

If set to yes posts made to this forum will be indexed for searching.

If set to yes topics made to this forum will be shown in the active topics list.

If non-zero this value will override the default topics per page setting.
Forum prune settings

Prunes the forum of topics, set the frequency/age parameters below.

Time in days between pruning events.
Days

Number of days since last post after which topic is removed.
Days

Number of days since topic was viewed after which topic is removed.
Days

Removes topics with polls not voted in for post age days.

Prunes the forum of shadow topics, set the frequency/age parameters below.

Time in days between pruning events.
Days

Number of days after which shadow topic is removed.
Days
General forum settings

Displays this forum on the index and elsewhere as a link within the legend of its parent-forum if the parent-forum’s “List subforums in legend” option is enabled.

Full URL (including the protocol, i.e.: http://) to the destination location that clicking this forum will take the user, e.g.: http://www.phpbb.com/.

Records the number of times a forum link was clicked.
Forum rules

You are able to enter the URL of the page/post containing your forum rules here. This setting will override the forum rules text you specified.

Forum rules are displayed at any page within the given forum.
Submit  
Powered by phpBB® Forum Software © phpBB Limited

Forum based permissions
  • Forum permissions
  • Copy forum permissions
  • Forum moderators

  • Group forum permissions

Setting permissions

Permissions are based on a simple YES/NO system. Setting an option to NEVER for a user or usergroup overrides any other value assigned to it. If you do not wish to assign a value for an option for this user or group select NO. If values are assigned for this option elsewhere they will be used in preference, else NEVER is assumed. All objects marked (with the checkbox in front of them) will copy the permission set you defined.


» Forum permissions


deletw [Forum permissions]

Guests
All YES · All NO · All NEVER
Advanced Permissions
No role assigned…
  • No Access
  • Read Only Access
  • Limited Access
  • Limited Access + Polls
  • Standard Access
  • Standard Access + Polls
  • Full Access
  • On Moderation Queue
  • Bot Access
  • Newly Registered User Access
  • Actions
  • Post
  • Content
  • Polls
Setting Yes No Never
Can see forum
Can see topics
Can read forum
Can search the forum
Can subscribe forum
Can print topics
Can email topics
Can bump topics
Can lock own topics
Can download files
Can report posts

The permissions and role defined for this item will only be applied to this item and all checked items.

Setting Yes No Never
Can start new topics
Can post stickies
Can post announcements
Can post global announcements
Can reply to topics
Can edit own posts
Can permanently delete own posts
Can soft delete own posts
Moderators, who have the approve posts permission, can restore soft deleted posts.
Can ignore flood limit
Increment post counter
Please note that this setting only affects new posts.
Can post without approval

The permissions and role defined for this item will only be applied to this item and all checked items.

Setting Yes No Never
Can attach files
Can use topic/post icons
Can use BBCode
Can use [flash] BBCode tag
Can use [img] BBCode tag
Can use signatures
Can use smilies

The permissions and role defined for this item will only be applied to this item and all checked items.

Setting Yes No Never
Can create polls
Can vote in polls
Can change existing vote

The permissions and role defined for this item will only be applied to this item and all checked items.



Submit changes

 



Powered by phpBB® Forum Software © phpBB Limited

Forum based permissions
  • Forum permissions

  • Forum moderators

  • Group forum permissions

Setting permissions

Permissions are based on a simple YES/NO system. Setting an option to NEVER for a user or usergroup overrides any other value assigned to it. If you do not wish to assign a value for an option for this user or group select NO. If values are assigned for this option elsewhere they will be used in preference, else NEVER is assumed. All objects marked (with the checkbox in front of them) will copy the permission set you defined.


» Forum permissions
